citation.article-title: Primorskyibacter sedentarius gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel member of the class Alphaproteobacteria from shallow marine sediments
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Primorskyibacter (Pri.mor′sky.i.bac′ter. N.L. n. Primorsky -yos Primorsky Kray, a Far-Eastern region of the Russian Federation, where the first strains were isolated; N.L. masc. n. bacter rod; N.L. masc. n. Primorskyibacter rod isolated from Primorsky Kray).
Gram-negative, strictly aerobic, oxidase- and catalase-positive, rod-shaped bacteria that are enlarged at one pole due to cell division by budding.
Sodium ions are essential for growth.
The predominant isoprenoid quinone is Q-10.
Polar lipids include phosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol and an unknown lipid.
The major fatty acid is C18 : 1ω7c, followed by 11-methyl C18 : 1ω7c. Known strains have been isolated from marine environments.

On the basis of 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis, the genus represents a separate branch within the Alphaproteobacteria closely related to the genera Marinovum, Leisingera, Phaeobacter and Thalassobius.
The type species of the genus is Primorskyibacter sedentarius.
